sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Humidity Chamber for stability testing and storage of pharmaceutical products under controlled temperature and humidity conditions.
sections.scope: Applicable to humidity-controlled storage activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the humidity chamber is installed in a suitable location with power supply.
Verify that water reservoir for humidity generation is filled with purified water.
Check that drain lines are properly connected and functional.
Power ON the humidity chamber using the main switch.
Set the desired temperature and relative humidity using the controller.
Allow the chamber to reach set conditions and stabilize.
Monitor both temperature and humidity displays for stability.
Verify conditions using calibrated temperature and humidity probes if required.
Open the door and arrange products ensuring proper air circulation.
Do not overload or block air circulation vents inside chamber.
Close the door securely ensuring proper sealing.
Monitor temperature and humidity continuously through display or data logger.
Record readings at specified intervals as per stability protocol.
Verify that conditions remain within specified tolerances.
Refill water reservoir periodically to maintain humidity generation.
Set alarms for out-of-specification temperature or humidity if available.
For long-term stability studies, maintain automated monitoring.
Minimize door opening frequency to maintain stable conditions.
Clean the chamber interior periodically with appropriate cleaning agents.
Check and clean humidity sensors regularly to ensure accuracy.
Perform preventive maintenance and calibration as per schedule.
Document all temperature, humidity data, and deviations in the logbook.
precautions: Use only purified or distilled water in the humidity generation system.
Do not overload the chamber as it affects air circulation.
Minimize door opening time to prevent condition fluctuations.
Ensure door gaskets are in good condition for proper sealing.
Monitor water level regularly and refill as needed.
Clean humidity sensors periodically to maintain accuracy.
Investigate and document any temperature or humidity excursions.
Ensure backup power supply for critical stability studies.
Perform regular calibration of temperature and humidity sensors.
